sen.j: 和田 英（わだ えい）は、「富岡日記」を著した女性。
sen.e: Ei WADA is a woman who wrote "Tomioka Diary."
Ei WADA is a woman who wrote 'Tomioka Diary.'
Ei WADA is a woman who wrote 'Tomioka Diary.'
Her maiden name was YOKOTA.
Her maiden name was YOKOTA.
Her maiden name was YOKOTA.

sen.j: 長野県埴科郡松代町（現・長野市松代町 (長野県)松代）に松代藩横田数馬の次女として生まれる。
sen.e: She was born as the second daughter of Kazuma YOKOTA from Matsushiro town, Hanishina-gun, Nagano Prefecture (present Matsushiro Town, Nagano City [Matsushiro, Nagano Prefecture]).
She was born as the second daughter of Kazuma YOKOTA from Matsushiro clan in Matsushiro-cho, Hanishina-gun, Nagano Prefecture (present Matsushiro Town, Nagano City [Matsushiro, Nagano Prefecture]).
sen.cmt: Matsushiro clan に訂正しました。in Matsushiro-cho を追加しました。
sen.e: She was born as the second daughter of Kazuma YOKOTA from Matsushiro clan in Matsushiro-cho, Hanishina-gun, Nagano Prefecture (present Matsushiro Town, Nagano City [Matsushiro, Nagano Prefecture]).

sen.j: 弟は秀雄(横田正俊の父)・謙二郎。
sen.e: Her younger brothers were Hideo (father of Masatoshi YOKOTA), Kenjiro.
Her younger brothers were Hideo (father of Masatoshi YOKOTA), Kenjiro.
Her younger brothers were Hideo (father of Masatoshi YOKOTA), Kenjiro.

sen.j: 1873年、16人の女工とともに富岡製糸場へ。
sen.e: In 1873, she went to Tomioka Seishi-jo (Tomioka Silk Mill) with other sixteen factory girls.
In 1873, she went to Tomioka Seishi-jo (Tomioka Silk Mill) with other sixteen factory girls.
In 1873, she went to Tomioka Seishi-jo (Tomioka Silk Mill) with other sixteen factory girls.

sen.j: 1874年、長野県埴科郡西条村(現・長野市松代町西条)の六工社の事業開始に伴い富岡製糸場を退職。
sen.e: In 1874, she retired from Tomioka Seishi-jo with the opening of Rokko-sha in Nishijo Village, Hanishina-gun, Nagano Prefecture (present Matsushiromachi Nishijyo, Nagano City).
In 1874, she retired from Tomioka Seishi-jo with the opening of Rokko-sha in Nishijo Village, Hanishina-gun, Nagano Prefecture (present Matsushiromachi Nishijyo, Nagano City).
In 1874, she retired from Tomioka Seishi-jo with the opening of Rokko-sha in Nishijo Village, Hanishina-gun, Nagano Prefecture (present Matsushiromachi Nishijyo, Nagano City).
She married to Seiji WADA.
She married to Seiji WADA.
She married to Seiji WADA.

sen.j: 盛治の死後、富岡製糸場での日々を回顧して「富岡日記」を著した。
sen.e: After the death of Seiji, she wrote "Tomioka Diary" remembering the days of Tomioka Seishi-jo.
After the death of Seiji, she wrote 'Tomioka Diary' remembering the days of Tomioka Seishi-jo.
After the death of Seiji, she wrote 'Tomioka Diary' remembering the days of Tomioka Seishi-jo.
